intro: Triodanis scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has hairy, rough-textured leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Triodanis scabra is often found in shaded areas and is an important component of early successional plant communities.
